text: Harvey Dean Williams Sr. (July 30, 1930 â€“ August 7, 2020) was a United States Army major general. He was the first African-American post commander of Fort Myer. He was the Deputy Inspector General of the U.S. Army in 1980. He was a commander in the Korean War and Vietnam War. He was born in Whiteville, North Carolina. Williams died from Parkinson's disease on August 7, 2020 in Germantown, Maryland at the age of 90. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American military personnel of the Korean War Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War Category:American generals Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Military people from North Carolina
title: Harvey D. Williams
